title: Chelsea vs Sunderland LIVE : Premier League latest score and confirmed lineups
body_text:
Chemsdine Talbi scored in the 93rd minute to give Sunderland a shock 2-1 win against Chelsea at Stamford Bridge and move to second in the Premier League table.
The Blues went into Saturday off the back of thrashing Ajax 5-1 in the Champions League, and were expected to extend their winning run to five games despite being level on points with the Black Cats ahead of kick-off.
Chelsea did get off to the perfect start, with Alejandro Garnacho opening his account for the club with a fine goal on the counter-attack, firing the ball through the legs of Robin Roefs inside four minutes.
No doubt, supporters were expecting the home side to run away with the three points, but in the 22nd minute Stamford Bridge was stunned into silence as a long throw into the box wasn’t dealt with, allowing Wilson Isidor to poke in the equaliser.
Sunderland more than deserved at least a point based on their first-half display, showing great energy and intensity, though they lacked real quality in the final third, with Isidor hitting the side netting before Robert Sanchez easily saved from Bertrand Traore.
Garnacho was easily the home side’s liveliest attacker, with Roefs making a fine save to deny the winger a second on the half-volley just before the break.
It was a surprise then, that Maresca hooked the Argentine before the hour mark for Estevao, with Marc Guiu and Joao Pedro staying on for nearly the whole match despite barely contributing.
Get your football fix

From the latest transfer rumours and managerial moves to analysis of the biggest games and a lot more, our experts have you covered.
Sign up here, it's an open goal.
It’s a change that nearly worked though, with Estevao coming close to scoring almost immediately, but chances were at a minimum for Chelsea despite dominating the second-half.
More Trending
Enzo Fernandez and Trevoh Chalobah had half-chances but for the most part Maresca’s team looked devoid of ideas, with the home support growing increasingly frustrated.
The Black Cats looked content with the draw, but snatched all three points when a long ball found Brian Brobbey, who held up the ball and teed up fellow substitute Talbi to drill into the bottom corner.
Metro’s LIVE matchday blog will bring you all the build-up, confirmed team news and starting XIs, goal updates and minute-by-minute coverage.
Live Feed
This Live Blog has now ended
This blog is now closed. For the latest updates, visit Metro’s Football page.
Goodbye!
That’s it for our coverage of Sunderland’s last gasp win over Chelsea.
The Premier League action isn’t over though as we have LIVE coverage of Manchester United vs Brighton.
Chelsea seventh, Sunderland go second
Elsewhere, Newcastle also beat Fulham 2-1 with an injury time winner.
The result in west London means Sunderland go second in the table while Chelsea are seventh, five points behind leaders Arsenal who will play Crystal Palace on Sunday.
Full-time! Chelsea 1-2 Sunderland
Sanchez comes up for one last Chelsea corner… it goes behind and the ref blows for full-time.
Disaster for Chelsea, delirium for Sunderland!
The Black Cats are second in the Premier League!
90+5 mins: Chelsea 1-2 Sunderland
It’s given!
Sanchez was in no man’s land as Talbi fired a first time shot into the bottom corner.
Incredible scenes at Stamford Bridge.
GOAL! Chelsea 1-2 Sunderland (Talbi)
OH MY WORD!
Sunderland have won it in the the 93rd minute!
Unless VAR have anything to say…
90 mins: Chelsea 1-1 Sunderland
Santos’ first contribution is to get booked. Not ideal.
SIX minutes added on…
86 mins: Chelsea 1-1 Sunderland
A last roll of the dice from Maresca: George and Santos are on for Pedro and Neto.
82 mins: Chelsea 1-1 Sunderland
Better from the visitors as Talbi looks to cross for Brobbey at the far post but Sanchez does well to get a touch and the danger is averted.
Both sides running out of time to find a winner…
77 mins: Chelsea 1-1 Sunderland
They’ve been on the back foot since half-time but Sunderland nearly take the lead!
One long ball finds a marauding Xhaka but Acheampong does really well to put off the ex-Arsenal captain and he scuffs the shot.
Maresca makes more changes: Guiu and Acheampong are off, with Gittens and Tosin on.
For the Black Cats, Le Fee and goalscorer Isidor come off for Brobbey and Rigg.
70 mins: Chelsea 1-1 Sunderland
It’s taken a while but we have the first yellow card of the game.
Le Fee is booked for a late sliding tackle on Chalobah
68 mins: Chelsea 1-1 Sunderland
Ouch. Cucurella is down after being clattered by Roefs as players contested a dangerous cross.
The left-back receives some treatment, while Sunderland make their first sub, Talbi replaces Traore.
63 mins: Chelsea 1-1 Sunderland
So nearly an instant impact from the sub!
Estevao brings down Cucurella’s cross and fires a powerful shot but its deflected behind.
It’s been almost all Chelsea in the second-half.
59 mins: Chelsea 1-1 Sunderland
Garnacho has a pop from range… way over the bar.
It’s his last touch, as Maresca brings Estevao on for the goalscorer.
Safe to say, Garnacho is NOT happy to be coming off and to be honest I can’t blame in.
56 mins: Chelsea 1-1 Sunderland
Neto does better here to win a free-kick on the right of the box.
James sends it in and finds Cucurella arriving at the near post. His glancing header is good but Sunderland have men back to block and clear it away.
52 mins: Chelsea 1-1 Sunderland
It’s more of the same after the break. End-to-end action.
Le Fee wins a free-kick off Chalobah in a dangerous position which is cleared behind for a corner. It’s dealt with and Chelsea counter.
A mistake from the defence means its two on one, but Neto’s pass to Garnacho is poor and the attack fizzles out.
Second-half kick-off! Chelsea 1-1 Sunderland
And away we go again.
No changes for either side.
Half-time! Chelsea 1-1 Sunderland
Not much to report from injury time. An action-packed first-half ends and 1-1 is the right result.
Chelsea probably thought they were going to run away with this after Garnacho scored after just four minutes but Sunderland have done very well and deserve their equaliser.
Maresca made half-time changes to save the game against Forest last week and he’ll need to do the same today.
45 mins: Chelsea 1-1 Sunderland
And another fine save from Roefs!
Chelsea can’t break down Sunderland’s defence, so Chalobah decides to have a pop from range. It’s a good one and a slight deflection forces Roefs to tip it over the bar.
The subsequent corner is cleared and we’ll have three minutes of injury time.
43 mins: Chelsea 1-1 Sunderland
Now it’s Sanchez’s turn to make a good save.
Sunderland counter and Traore takes a shot from the edge of the box but the Spaniard claims the ball with relative ease.
42 mins: Chelsea 1-1 Sunderland
Chelsea work a corner well, as they have done all game and Garnacho is sliding in at the far post unmarked.
He gets his effort on target but Roefs does really well to get across and make the save.
